critique: The document pertains to federal pay administration and the process by which the President receives advice on federal pay systems. It amends Executive Order No. 11721, designating the Secretary of Labor, the Director of the Office of Management and Budget, and the Chairman of the United States Civil Service Commission as the President's Pay Agent. It also establishes an Advisory Committee on Federal Pay to advise the President on unresolved issues. The document does not directly address ideological issues, immigration, executive power, federalism, security vs. liberty, economic regulation, or social inclusion in a way that would strongly indicate a bias in any particular direction.
